Welcome to Rest API’s documentation!¶

REST API main¶

This module defines the main FastAPI application for the project.

The application includes middleware for measuring performance and handling CORS requests, as well as routes for user authentication, user management, and contact management.

Additionally, the module includes startup logic for initializing a Redis instance and a database connection pool, and a healthchecker endpoint for verifying the application’s connection to the database.

Dependencies: - fastapi - fastapi_limiter - sqlalchemy - redis - uvicorn

Usage:

Run the module directly to start the application server.

async main.custom_middleware(request: Request, call_next)¶
main.healthchecker(db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
main.main_pange()¶
async main.startup()¶

REST API database Db¶

src.database.db.get_db()¶
The get_db function is a context manager that returns a database session.

It will automatically rollback the session if an exception occurs, and close it when the with block ends.

Returns:

A database session, which is used to execute queries and transactions

Doc-author:

Ihor Voitiuk

REST API repository Users¶

async src.repository.users.confirmed_email(email: str, db: Session) → None¶

The confirmed_email function takes an email and a database session as arguments. It then gets the user from the database using that email, sets their confirmed field to True, and commits those changes to the database.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Get the email of the user

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

None, but it does update the user’s confirmed field to true

Doc-author:

Ihor Voitiuk

async src.repository.users.create_user(body: UserModel, db: Session) → User¶

The create_user function creates a new user in the database. It takes a UserModel object and returns a User object.

Parameters:

  • body – UserModel: Create a new user object from the data passed in

  • db – Session: Pass in the database session

Returns:

A user object

Doc-author:

Ihor Voitiuk

async src.repository.users.get_user_by_email(email: str, db: Session) → User¶

The get_user_by_email function takes an email and a database session as arguments. It then queries the database for a user with that email address, returning the first result. If no such user exists, it returns None.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Specify the type of the parameter

  • db – Session: Pass in the database session

Returns:

The first user in the database that matches the email provided

Doc-author:

Ihor Voitiuk

async src.repository.users.reset_password(email: str, new_password: str, db: Session) → None¶

The reset_password function takes an email and a new password, and updates the user’s password in the database.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Identify the user

  • new_password – str: Set the new password for the user

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

None

Doc-author:

Ihor Voitiuk

async src.repository.users.update_avatar(email: str, url: str, db: Session) → User¶

The update_avatar function takes an email and a url as arguments. It then uses the get_user_by_email function to retrieve the user from the database. The avatar attribute of that user is set to be equal to the url argument, and then the db session is committed so that it can be saved in our database.

Parameters:

  • email – Find the user in the database

  • url – str: Specify the type of the parameter

  • db – Session: Pass a database session to the function

Returns:

The updated user object

Doc-author:

Ihor Voitiuk

async src.repository.users.update_token(user: User, token: str | None, db: Session) → None¶

The update_token function updates the refresh token for a user.

Parameters:

  • user – User: Identify the user that is being updated

  • token – str | None: Update the refresh_token field in the user table

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

None

Doc-author:

Ihor Voitiuk

REST API repository Contents¶

async src.repository.contacts.birthday_contacts(db: Session)¶

The birthday_contacts function returns a list of contacts whose birthday is within the next week.

Parameters:

db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A list of contacts that have a birthday within the next 7 days

Ihor Voitiuk

The create_contact function takes in a Contact object and adds it to the database.

Parameters:

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

The created contact object

The get_contact_by_id function takes in a contact_id and returns the corresponding Contact object.
Args:

contact_id (int): The id of the desired Contact object.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Specify the id of the contact to be retrieved

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

The first contact in the database with an id equal to the one passed as a parameter

Doc-author:

Ihor Voitiuk

async src.repository.contacts.get_contacts(limit: int, offset: int, db: Session)¶
The get_contacts function returns a list of contacts from the database.
Args:

limit (int): The number of contacts to return. offset (int): The index at which to start returning contacts.

Parameters:

  • limit – int: Limit the number of contacts returned

  • offset – int: Specify the number of records to skip

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A list of contact objects

Doc-author:

Ihor Voitiuk

async src.repository.contacts.remove_contact(contact_id: int, db: Session)¶
The remove_contact function removes a contact from the database.
Args:

contact_id (int): The id of the contact to be removed. db (Session): A session object that is used to query and update the database.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Specify the contact to be deleted

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

The contact object that was deleted

Doc-author:

Ihor Voitiuk

async src.repository.contacts.search_contacts(db: Session, first_name: str = None, last_name: str = None, email: str = None)¶
The search_contacts function searches the database for contacts that match the given parameters.

If no parameters are provided, it returns None.

Parameters:

  • db – Session: Pass in the database session

  • first_name – str: Search for a contact by first name

  • last_name – str: Filter the results by last name

  • email – str: Search for a contact by email

Returns:

A list of contact objects

Doc-author:

Ihor Voitiuk

async src.repository.contacts.update_contact(contact_id: int, body: ContactModel, db: Session)¶
The update_contact function takes in a Contact object and updates it in the database.
Args:

contact_id (int): The id of the desired Contact object. body (ContactModel): The Contact object to be updated in the database.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Specify the id of the contact to be updated

  • body – ContactModel: Specify the contact object to be updated in the database

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

The updated contact object

Doc-author:

Ihor Voitiuk

REST API routes Auth¶

async src.routes.auth.confirmed_email(token: str, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The confirmed_email function is used to confirm a user’s email address.

It takes the token from the URL and uses it to get the user’s email address. Then, it gets that user from our database and checks if their account has already been confirmed. If so, we return a message saying as much; otherwise, we update their account in our database with an updated confirmed value of True.

Parameters:

  • token – str: Get the token from the url

  • db – Session: Get a database session

Returns:

A message to the user

Doc-author:

Ihor Voitiuk

async src.routes.auth.login(body: OAuth2PasswordRequestForm = Depends(OAuth2PasswordRequestForm), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The login function is used to authenticate a user.

Parameters:

  • body – OAuth2PasswordRequestForm: Validate the request body

  • db – Session: Get a database session

Returns:

A dictionary with three keys:

Doc-author:

Ihor Voitiuk

async src.routes.auth.refresh_token(credentials: HTTPAuthorizationCredentials = Security(HTTPBearer), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The refresh_token function is used to refresh the access token. It takes a valid refresh token and returns a new access token. The function also updates the user’s refresh_token in the database.

Parameters:

  • credentials – HTTPAuthorizationCredentials: Validate the token

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

:param : Get the user’s email from the token :return: A new access token and refresh token :doc-author: Ihor Voitiuk

async src.routes.auth.request_email(body: RequestEmail, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The request_email function is used to request a confirmation email. It takes the user’s email address and sends them an email with a link that they can click on to confirm their account.

Parameters:

  • body – RequestEmail: Get the email from the request body

  • background_tasks – BackgroundTasks: Add a task to the background tasks queue

  • request – Request: Get the base_url of the application

  • db – Session: Get the database session

:param : Get the token from the url :return: A message to the user :doc-author: Ihor Voitiuk

async src.routes.auth.reset_password(body: RequestEmail, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The reset_password function is used to reset a user’s password. It takes the email of the user as input and sends an email with a link to change their password. The function returns a message indicating whether or not it was successful.

Parameters:

  • body – RequestEmail: Get the email from the request body

  • background_tasks – BackgroundTasks: Add a task to the background queue

  • request – Request: Get the base_url of the application

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

:param : Get the user id from the token :return: A message to the user :doc-author: Ihor Voitiuk

async src.routes.auth.reset_password_token(token: str, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The reset_password_token function is used to reset a user’s password.

It takes the token as an argument and returns a message that the user can change their password.

Parameters:

  • token – str: Get the token from the url

  • db – Session: Get the database session

Returns:

A message that the user can change their password

Doc-author:

Ihor Voitiuk

async src.routes.auth.signup(body: UserModel, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The signup function creates a new user in the database. It takes a UserModel object as input, which is validated by FastAPI. The function then checks if an account with that email already exists, and if so raises an HTTP 409 Conflict error. If no account exists with that email address, it hashes the password using auth_service’s get_password_hash() function and saves the new user to the database using repository_users’ create_user() function. Finally it adds a task to send confirmation emails via send_email(). The return value is a dictionary containing details about what happened.

Parameters:

  • body – UserModel: Get the data from the request body

  • background_tasks – BackgroundTasks: Add a task to the background queue

  • request – Request: Get the base url of the application

  • db – Session: Get the database session

:param : Get the user’s email and username :return: A dict with a user key and a detail key :doc-author: Ihor Voitiuk

async src.routes.auth.updade_contac(body: PsswordModel, user_email: str = Path(Ellipsis), db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: Contact = Depends(current_user))¶

The updade_contac function update password user.

Parameters:

  • body – PsswordModel: Get the password and confirm_password from the request body

  • user_email – str: Get the email of the user to update password

  • db – Session: Get the database session

  • current_user – Contact: Get the current user

:param : Get the user’s email :return: A message :doc-author: Ihor Voitiuk

The get_contacts function returns a list of contacts.

Parameters:

  • le – Limit the number of contacts returned by the api

  • offset – int: Skip the first n records

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

  • current_user – Contact: Get the current user

:param : Limit the number of contacts returned :return: A list of contacts :doc-author: Ihor Voitiuk

async src.routes.contacts.remove_contact(contact_id: int = Path(Ellipsis), db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: Contact = Depends(current_user))¶

The remove_contact function deletes a contact from the database.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Get the id of the contact to delete

  • ge – Specify that the contact_id must be greater than or equal to 1

  • db – Session: Get the database session

  • current_user – Contact: Get the current user from the database

:param : Get the id of the contact to update :return: The contact that was deleted :doc-author: Ihor Voitiuk

async src.routes.contacts.search_contacts(first_name: str = Query(None), last_name: str = Query(None), email: str = Query(None), db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: Contact = Depends(current_user))¶
The search_contacts function is used to search for contacts in the database.

The function takes in a first name, last name, and email address as parameters. It then searches the database for any contacts that match those parameters and returns them or None.

Parameters:

  • first_name – str: Pass the first name of a contact to search for

  • last_name – str: Search for contacts by last name

  • email – str: Search for a contact by email

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the respository_contacts

  • current_user – Contact: Get the current user from the database

:param : Specify the type of data that is expected in the request body :return: A list of contacts :doc-author: Ihor Voitiuk

async src.routes.contacts.updade_contac(body: ContactModel, contact_id: int = Path(Ellipsis), db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: Contact = Depends(current_user))¶

The updade_contac function updates a contact in the database.

Parameters:

  • body – ContactModel: Validate the input data

  • contact_id – int: Get the id of the contact to delete

  • ge – Specify that the contact_id must be greater than or equal to 1

  • db – Session: Get the database session

  • current_user – Contact: Get the current user from the database

:param : Get the id of the contact to delete :return: A contactmodel object :doc-author: Ihor Voitiuk

REST API service Auth¶

class src.services.auth.Auth¶

Bases: object

This class provides helper methods for authentication, such as hashing passwords, generating JWT tokens, and decoding JWT tokens.

Attributes: - pwd_context (CryptContext): A context object for hashing passwords. - SECRET_KEY (str): The secret key used to encode and decode JWT tokens. - ALGORITHM (str): The hashing algorithm used to encode and decode JWT tokens. - oauth2_scheme (OAuth2PasswordBearer): An OAuth2 scheme used for token-based authentication. - redis (Redis): A Redis instance used for caching user information. :doc-author: Ihor Voitiuk

ALGORITHM = 'HS256'¶
SECRET_KEY = 'secret_key'¶
async create_access_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None)¶
The create_access_token function creates a new access token.

The function takes in the data to be encoded, and an optional expires_delta parameter. If no expires_delta is provided, the default value of 15 minutes will be used. The iat (issued at) claim is added automatically by PyJWT and set to utcnow(). This means that when we decode this token later on, we can check if it has expired or not.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • data – dict: Pass in the data that will be encoded into the jwt

  • expires_delta – Optional[float]: Set the expiration time of the token

Returns:

A token that is encoded with the jwt algorithm

Doc-author:

Ihor Voitiuk

create_email_token(data: dict)¶

The create_email_token function creates a token that is used to verify the user’s email address. The token is created using the JWT library and contains information about when it was issued, when it expires, and what scope (or purpose) it has. The function returns this token.

Parameters:

  • self – Make the function a method of the class

  • data – dict: Pass the data that will be encoded in the token

Returns:

A token

Doc-author:

Ihor Voitiuk

async create_refresh_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None)¶
The create_refresh_token function creates a refresh token for the user.

The function takes in three arguments: self, data, and expires_delta. The self argument is the class itself (OAuth2PasswordBearer). The data argument is a dictionary containing information about the user’s session. This includes their username and password hash as well as other information such as their email address or phone number if they have provided it to us. It also contains an iat key which stands for &quot;issued at&quot; time which tells us when this token was created and an exp key which stands for expiration time that tells us when this

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • data – dict: Pass the data that will be encoded into the token

  • expires_delta – Optional[float]: Set the expiration time of the refresh token

Returns:

A refresh token that is encoded with the user’s id, username and email

Doc-author:

Ihor Voitiuk

async current_user(token: str = Depends(OAuth2PasswordBearer), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The current_user function is a dependency that will be injected into the

function that requires it. It will return the user object for the current request, if there is one. If not, it raises an HTTPException with status code 401.

Parameters:

  • self – Access the class attributes

  • token – str: Get the token from the authorization header

  • db – Session: Get the database session

Returns:

The user object associated with the token

Doc-author:

Ihor Voitiuk

async decode_refresh_token(refresh_token: str)¶
The decode_refresh_token function is used to decode the refresh token.

The function takes in a refresh_token as an argument and returns the email of the user if successful. If not, it raises an HTTPException with status code 401 (Unauthorized) and detail message &quot;Invalid scope for token&quot; or &quot;Could not validate credentials&quot;.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • refresh_token – str: Pass in the refresh token that is sent to the server

Returns:

The email of the user

Doc-author:

Ihor Voitiuk

async get_email_from_token(token: str)¶

The get_email_from_token function takes a token as an argument and returns the email associated with that token. If the scope of the token is not &quot;email_token&quot;, then it raises an HTTPException. If there is a JWTError, then it also raises an HTTPException.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • token – str: Pass in the token that we want to decode

Returns:

The email address associated with the token

Doc-author:

Ihor Voitiuk

get_password_hash(password: str)¶

The get_password_hash function takes a password and returns the hashed version of it. The hashing algorithm is defined in the config file, which is passed to CryptContext.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • password – str: Specify the password that is to be hashed

Returns:

A password hash

Doc-author:

Ihor Voitiuk

oauth2_scheme = <fastapi.security.oauth2.OAuth2PasswordBearer object>¶
pwd_context = <CryptContext>¶
redis = Redis<ConnectionPool<Connection<host=localhost,port=6379,db=0>>>¶
verify_password(plain_password, hashed_password)¶

The verify_password function takes a plain-text password and hashed password as arguments. It then uses the CryptContext object to verify that the plain-text password matches the hashed version. If it does, it returns True; if not, False.

Parameters:

  • self – Make the method a bound method, which means that it can be called on instances of the class

  • plain_password – Pass in the password that is entered by the user

  • hashed_password – Pass in the hashed password from the database

Returns:

True if the password is correct and false otherwise

Doc-author:

Ihor Voitiuk

REST API service Email¶

async src.services.email.mail.send_email(email: EmailStr, username: str, host: str, subj: str = 'Confirm your email ')¶
The send_email function is used to send an email to a user.
It takes in the following parameters:

  • email: The recipient’s email address.

  • username: The recipient’s username. This will be displayed in the body of the message, and can be customized by editing templates/email_template.html or templates/email_template_reset_password.html .

  • host: The hostname of your server (e.g., localhost; if you’re running this locally). This will also be displayed in the body of the message, and can be customized by editing templates/email_template

Parameters:

  • email – EmailStr: Pass in the email address of the user

  • username – str: Fill in the username field in the email template

  • host – str: Pass the hostname of the server to be used in the email template

  • subj – str: Specify the subject of the email

Returns:

A coroutine

Doc-author:

Ihor Voitiuk

REST API seed Contacts to db¶

src.seed.contacts_to_db.create_contact_person(quantity)¶

The create_contact_person function creates a contact person with the following attributes: first_name, last_name, email, phone_number, birthday and description. The function takes one argument which is the quantity of contacts to be created.

Parameters:

quantity – Determine how many contact persons are created

Returns:

None

Doc-author:

Ihor Voitiuk
